intro: Saprosma brassii, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Saprosma brassii thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas and dry forests.
